table.name: location_role_profile
table.description: Detail information about the location role(s). The detail information consists of the minimum stop time at the location, location hours per role. For e.g., the location time for the loading zone can be 8 AM to 5 PM but unloading time may be 12 noon to 7 PM.

columns.name: LOCATION_GID
columns.description: The GID for the location.

columns.name: LOCATION_ROLE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the location role.

columns.name: CALENDAR_GID
columns.description: The GID for the calendar used for the location role profile.

columns.name: X_DOCK_IS_INBOUND_BIAS
columns.description: The inbound bias flag for the cross-dock should be selected if you want to emphasize optimization inbound to the cross-dock. If you clear the check box, then the system will optimize outbound from the cross-dock instead.

columns.name: FIXED_HANDLING_TIME
columns.description: Fixed amount of time. No matter the size of the shipment required for handling.

columns.name: FIXED_HANDLING_TIME_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the fixed handling time. Days, hours, minutes.

columns.name: FIXED_HANDLING_TIME_BASE
columns.description: The fixed handling time in base units.

columns.name: VAR_HANDLING_TIME
columns.description: Amount of time required to handle the amount of weight defined by the variable handling weight value.

columns.name: VAR_HANDLING_TIME_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the variable handling time. Days, hours, minutes.

columns.name: VAR_HANDLING_TIME_BASE
columns.description: Variable handling time in base units.

columns.name: CREATE_XDOCK_HANDLING_SHIPMENT
columns.description: Using the Create Crossdock Handling Shipment field creates handling shipments as part of the cross-dock building process. Clear the check box to bulk plan cross-docks without handling shipments. Fixed Handling Time: Same as above. The Variable Handling Time and the Variable Handling Weight: Same as above. Max Freight Idle Time: Same as above.

columns.name: CREATE_POOL_HANDLING_SHIPMENT
columns.description: Creates pool handling shipments.

columns.name: VAR_HANDLING_WEIGHT
columns.description: Variable handling time weight defines rate of handling defined by weight.

columns.name: VAR_HANDLING_WEIGHT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the variable handling time weight.

columns.name: VAR_HANDLING_WEIGHT_BASE
columns.description: Variable handling time weight in the base unit of measure.

columns.name: MAX_FREIGHT_IDLE_TIME
columns.description: Maximum time freight can sit idle at the cross-dock.

columns.name: MAX_FREIGHT_IDLE_TIME_UOM_CODE
columns.description: Unit of measure for the maximum idle time.

columns.name: MAX_FREIGHT_IDLE_TIME_BASE
columns.description: Idle time in the base unit of measure.

columns.name: PCT_ACTIVITY_BEFORE_LOC_OPEN
columns.description: This value will be divided by 100 in the application to be used as a percentage. The valid value for this column is >= 0 and <= 100. When it is null, treat as 0 for location role SHIPPING/RECEIVING

columns.name: PCT_ACTIVITY_AFTER_LOC_CLOSE
columns.description: This value will be divided by 100 in the application to be used as a percentage. The valid value for this column is >= 0 and <= 100. When null, treat as 100 for location role SHIPPING/RECEIVING

columns.name: DOMAIN_NAME
columns.description: Database domain where this data is stored.

columns.name: INSERT_USER
columns.description: The user ID of the data insert user.

columns.name: INSERT_DATE
columns.description: Date and time of data insert.

columns.name: UPDATE_USER
columns.description: The user ID of the data update user.

columns.name: UPDATE_DATE
columns.description: Date and time of the most recent data update.

columns.name: IS_ALLOW_MIXED_FREIGHT
columns.description: Check box option used to indicate if mixed freight (e.g., a rainbow pallet) will be allowed, is so then select the Allow Mixed Freight option.

columns.name: THU_PROFILE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the transport profile. To handle mixed items you need to include the THU profile here and on the order release line. You also need to attach appropriate packaging reference unit (PRU) to the THU to indicate that it is a mixed THU that takes only mixed items but does not take SAME or LIKE items. See Order Release Line help for details.

columns.name: VAR_HNDCST_WGT
columns.description: The planning handling cost weight at this location.

columns.name: VAR_HNDCST_WGT_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure for the variable handling cost.

columns.name: VAR_HNDCST_WGT_BASE
columns.description: The variable handling cost weight in base units.

columns.name: VAR_HNDCST_WGT_COST
columns.description: Variable Handling Cost Per Weight at this location.

columns.name: VAR_HNDCST_WGT_COST_CURR_GID
columns.description: The GID for the variable handling cost weight currency.

columns.name: VAR_HNDCST_WGT_COST_BASE
columns.description: The variable handling cost weight in base units

columns.name: VAR_HNDCST_VOL
columns.description: The planning handling cost volume at this location.

columns.name: VAR_HNDCST_VOL_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The handling cost volume unit of measure.

columns.name: VAR_HNDCST_VOL_BASE
columns.description: The handling cost volume in base units.

columns.name: VAR_HNDCST_VOL_COST
columns.description: The variable handling cost per volume at this location.

columns.name: VAR_HNDCST_VOL_COST_CURR_GID
columns.description: The GID for the variable handling cost volume currency.

columns.name: VAR_HNDCST_VOL_COST_BASE
columns.description: The variable handling cost per volume in base units.
